discussion.content:
A. They shield the developer from needing in-depth expertise on the functionality of the cloud-based application.
D. They free the developer up to focus on building the business logic for related business processes.

questions.question_text: Identify two reasons why Oracle Cloud Adapters make it easier to integrate a SOA Suite application with a cloud-based application.

choices.D: They free the developer up to focus on building the business logic for related business processes.
choices.C: They come with a configuration wizard that is accessible from Enterprise Manager.
choices.A: They shield the developer from needing in-depth expertise on the functionality of the cloud-based application.
choices.B: They help the developer master the intricacies of the cloud application’s data model and mechanisms for security and session management.

choices.A: by developing BPEL processes that orchestrate a number of third-party service calls to complete a new business activity.
choices.C: by developing RESTful web services that provide logic to enrich third-party service responses
choices.D: by developing mediators that handle last-mile transformation and routing of messages to and from third-party services
choices.B: by developing ADF screen flows that percent unified views of the third-party service functionality to in-house portal users

questions.question_text:
Your company wants to extend a number of in-house applications with the third-party service functionality.
Identify two ways in which this can be accomplished using Oracle SOA Suite.

discussion.content:
A. by developing BPEL processes that orchestrate a number of third-party service calls to complete a new business activity.
D. by developing mediators that handle last-mile transformation and routing of messages to and from third-party services

choices.D: correcting the namespace prefixes in line 8
choices.B: adding the attribute bpelx :insertMissingFromData="yes" to line 2
choices.A: adding the attribute bpelx :insertMissingToData="yes" to line 2
choices.C: correcting the namespace prefixes in line 5

discussion.content:
A. adding the attribute bpelx :insertMissingToData="yes" to line 2
D. correcting the namespace prefixes in line 8
correcting the namespace prefixes in line 8 to ns3 for sure

questions.question_text:
Consider the current values of BPEL variables InputVariable andOutputVariable:
//IMG//

Then consider the following BPEL activity Assign1:
<assign name="Assign1"> <!- - Line 1- ->
<copy> <!- - Line 2 - ->
<from variable ="InputVariable" <!- - Line 3 - -> part = "query_Input" <!- - Line 4 - -> query="/ns2: query_Input/ns2:Row_Id"/> <!- - Line 5 - ->
<to variable ="OutputVariable" <!- - Line 6 - -> part = "query_Output" <!- - Line 7 - -> query="/ns2: query_Outnput/ns2:RowId"/> <!- - Line 8 - ->
</copy> <!- - Line 9 - ->
</assign> <!- - Line 10 - ->
Which two changes allow Assign1 to work with the current values of InputVariable andOutputVariable?

discussion.content:
B. A human task can invoke another human task in the same composite.
C. A BPEL process can invoke a human task in a different composite.

choices.D: A human task can invoke another human task in a different composite.
choices.C: A BPEL process can invoke a human task in a different composite.
choices.A: A web service client in a different composite can invoke a human task.
choices.B: A human task can invoke another human task in the same composite.

questions.question_text: Which two statements accurately describe the invoking of a human task?

discussion.content:
A. The decision table’s spreadsheet metaphor is compact and familiar to end users.
E. Built-in error prevention features for decision tables can help you build more complete and accurate rules.

choices.E: Built-in error prevention features for decision tables can help you build more complete and accurate rules.
choices.B: Decision tables can use globals whereas if-then rules cannot.
choices.C: The logic will likely require more rules if expressed as a decision table.
choices.A: The decision table’s spreadsheet metaphor is compact and familiar to end users.
choices.D: Unlike with a decision table, an Expression Builder is provided for if-then rules to help you craft condition expressions.

questions.question_text:
You have a situation where a collection of rules might provide a flexible way of externalizing logic in an application.
Which two are accurate considerations to assess when you decide to use a decision table or if-then rules?
